jobTitle: Associate Director Assay Development & Transfer - Translational Pathology Biomarker Testing Laboratory (TPBTL)
jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. By working together with a shared dedication and diverse perspectives, we are able to reach our full potential and make a real difference in the world. Seagen is a fast-growing company and has an abundance of opportunities available for you to grow your career. Put your passion to work at Seagen and join us! Summary Seagen is seeking an Associate Director, Translational Pathology Biomarker Testing Laboratory (TPBTL) Operations, as part of the Clinical Biomarker and Diagnostics (CBDx) Team within the Seagen Translational Sciences organization. The CBDx Team functions to generate, implement, and execute biomarker strategies for Seagen’s drug programs that have progressed to clinical development. CBDx collaborates cross-functionally with other areas of Seagen as well as with external partners to achieve goals that are critical for drug development. The Associate Director, Translational Pathology Biomarker Testing Laboratory (TPBTL) Operations will drive the assay development and transfer function of the TPBTL. They will ensure efficient assay transfers from other parts of the organization, assay development and assay optimization and analytical validation for the development of robust prototype assays, using immunohistochemistry and in situ hybridization, and other technologies, in the broader context of precision medicine and multi-plex, multi-technology, testing modalities. Principal Responsibilities Utilizing the technologies including but not limited to Molecular Pathology, Genomics, Immunochemistry, In-Situ Hybridization and Next Gen Sequencing, the Associate Director, Translational Pathology Biomarker Testing Laboratory (TPBTL) Operations, is responsible for development and optimization and validation of clinical biomarker assays in all therapeutic areas and in all phases of clinical development. The Associate Director will deploy histopathology-based biomarker assays such as singleplex immunohistochemistry and multiplex techniques to inform pipeline decisions for early and late phase clinical trials of all therapeutic areas, with a focus on Oncology. We are seeking for a highly motivated Associate Director with a doctoral degree (PhD/MD/PharmD) or Master’s and equivalent experience who has expert knowledge and 15+ years of experience with histopathology-based biomarker assays and their role in drug and assay development process, a history of successful CDx development with FDA approvals, and publication in the area of assay development. Candidate must possess scientific excellence and strong understanding of clinical biomarkers, ability to work independently with internal and external collaborators within a highly matrixed organization and excellent written and verbal communication skills to be able to clearly communicate scientific objectives and interpret data. Candidate should also have a strong interest in Translational Sciences and Precision Medicine. This individual will have a critical role in overseeing the histopathology-based clinical assay development, analytical validation, and clinical sample analysis to predict likelihood of response to treatment and/or better understand biological mechanisms of disease and therapeutic resistance for supporting our company’s early and late phase clinical trials in close collaboration with other Research and Development Teams. Responsibilities The Associate Director will own, set up, oversee, and develop the Translational Pathology Biomarker Testing Laboratory (TPBTL) Assay Transfer and Assay Development section. They will serve as a subject matter expert in tissue-based and liquid-based assay development and validation, including robust prototype assay development, clinical trial assay development and potential CDx development, collaborating with research, project teams, biomarker leads, external partners and others on the implementation of these assays in clinical trials Lead clinical development and analytical validation of histopathology-based (e.g., immunohistochemistry, multiplex, in-situ hybridization), Next Gen Sequencing, and other assays for all therapeutic areas and all phases of clinical development Provide TPBTL leadership in the transfer of biomarker assays from Research, Development and other business areas to by providing technical guidance on fit-for-purpose assay validation, and transfer of robust prototype assays to 3rd parties for potential CDx development. Will work across departments and collaborate to optimize early assay development to ensure smooth transition to robust prototype assay development and seamless assay transfer Deploy histopathology-based and other assays to external vendors for supporting our company's clinical trials in global scale and for potential CDx development, provide scientific oversight on clinical sample analysis ongoing at these vendors by ensuring assay and data quality over time, and troubleshoot potential issues efficiently Serve as subject matter expert in scientific qualification of new vendors Interface with scientists and physicians in early and late-stage clinical development to execute biomarker strategies in clinical trials Write memos, final reports and publications summarizing data, and writing/updating lab SOPs Required Qualifications Master’s Degree in STEM field 15+ Experience in histopathology-based assay development and validation such as monoplex and multiplex immunohistochemistry (IHC), in-situ hybridization (ISH) and basic knowledge of morphology in histopathological samples Recognized expert in clinical biomarkers and companion diagnostics with significant experience in Robust Prototype Assay Development and transfer to external partners History of achieving FDA approval for developed CDx assays Prior experience in the fields of oncology and immuno-oncology Can lead an inter-department project or initiative involving other contributors Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Must be able to work independently, strong leadership skills Ability to execute and thrive within a matrixed organization Being self-motivated and eager to learn and evaluate new technologies Successful patents in field of immunohistochemical assays Publication in a top tier clinical journal such as Lancet, JAMA, Nature, Journal of Clinical Oncology etc. Preferred Qualifications PhD Hands-on experience in clinical development/operation or managing the implementation of biomarker assays in support of drug development Broad knowledge of drug development process and translational medicine Experience in Next Gen Sequencing or other molecular techniques Prior experience working in a regulated laboratory setting (e.g., CAP/CLIA) Experience with Regulated Clinical Bioanalysis Experience in multiplex tissue-based spatial profiling assays (i.e. multiplex immunofluorescence, multiplex chromogenic immunohistochemistry Hands on experience on acquisition and analysis of singleplex/multiplex tissue-based assay images and single cell level high-dimensional data generation/analysis Experience with image acquisition platforms (e.g., Leica Aperio, Hamamatsu, 3DHISTECH Pannoramic) Experience with digital image analysis of histopathological samples (H&E and/or IHC stained) by using commercial image analysis software packages (e.g., Visiopharm, HALO, PathAI) Knowledge of using statistical software packages (e.g., Prism, SPSS). The successful candidate will be a key contributor to clinical protocols for statistical concept as well as broader drug development concepts, perform or oversee performance of analyses of clinical trial data, provide statistical interpretation of results, and will collaborate on the reporting of clinical trial results to regulatory authorities and the scientific community while ensuring adherence to regulatory and company standards. The AD, HRBP maintains an effective level of business literacy about the business unit's financial position, its midrange plans, its culture and its competition. The AD, HRBP serves as an executive coach for senior leadership and mentor for other positions in the function. To succeed, you will need a flexible skill set, including the ability to think strategically, execute tactically, and collaborate across many teams, levels, and situations. The individual in this role must understand business priorities and translate them into an HR agenda that supports the business as it grows. jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. Summary Seagen is looking for a Market Development Manager (MDM) to support the PADCEV brand team. The MDM is an exceptional leader with deep mUC experience who will work regionally to drive results in these areas: developing Advocacy, capturing, interpreting, and synthesizing Insights and optimizing Educational Effectiveness, and serve as the primary internal lead for promotional programming. The MDM will report to the Vice President, PADCEV Franchise lead, and will collaborate cross-functionally on field activities as a strategic partner with Marketing, Market Planning, Legal, Compliance, Sales Management, Sales Training, Managed Markets, Medical Affairs, and co-promotion program partner. Advocacy In partnership with the MDM and brand teams, the MDM will identify and engage with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) with the objective of building awareness of Seagen and our labeled indications. The MDM will monitor KOL opinions about treatment patterns in our labeled (and potential) indications, syndicate this information with appropriate corporate and field-based colleagues, and assist in the development of partnership opportunities with KOLs. Additionally, this role will serve as the primary interface for speaker programming, coordinating across internal stakeholders. Key Deliverables Include Manage and implement a cross-functional KOL strategy identifying and executing against actionable metrics, in partnership with the brand team Drive awareness within labeled indications and be primarily accountable for commercial partnerships with KOLs utilizing outstanding business and clinical acumen Identify, assess, and tier mUC KOLs and lead the development of KOL beliefs and influence mapping Partner with the managed markets team to identify managed care opinion leaders and coordinate KOL support for on-label reimbursement issues Collaborate closely with marketing to identify partnering opportunities with KOLs and assist with KOL recruitment for specific marketing initiatives Collaborate effectively and compliantly with Medical Affairs partners to ensure efficient utilization and communication with KOLs in alignment with Brand strategies and tactics Serve as the point person and coordinate across teams on speaker programs; deliverables require working with and collaborating across both internal and co-promote partners Insights The MDM will be responsible for capturing, analyzing, and interpreting KOL sentiments and sharing their findings with the brand team at regular intervals. KOL sentiments will be captured via MDM observations and during individual engagements that occur with a defined cohort of KOLs throughout the year. Key Deliverables Include Capturing KOL sentiments consistently and accurately Providing insights reports to the brand team at pre-defined intervals Managing and conducting MDM and brand team Business Planning Meetings Providing succinct and informative post-conference summaries to the brand team (both written and verbal) Educational Effectiveness The MDM will be expected to exhibit expert level disease state and product knowledge and will be responsible for demonstrating clinical acumen when conducting customer interactions. The MDM will be responsible for ensuring accurate and fair-balanced representation of all Seagen products for which they support. Key Deliverables Include Serve as the internal point person for promotional speaker programming Manage Speaker program vendor Develop annual Speaker’s Bureau plan Develop and execute an annual KOL engagement plan for a defined region Ensure compliant, fair-balanced, and effective message delivery within all MDM educational channels Observe and assess Seagen educational programs Provide insights and opportunities to improve programming Enlist appropriate KOLs to successfully support commercial activities, in partnership with the brand team Work with appropriate partners to compliantly identify potential speakers Manage the contracting, training, and on-going educational efforts with contracted promotional speakers Deliver action oriented real-time feedback and coaching to Seagen’s contracted educators as appropriate Assess speaker utilization and ensure compliance with internal guidelines KOL Engagement The MDM will be the primary field-based marketing resource responsible for the success of marketing initiatives designed to engage KOLs and will play a key liaison role between our external customers and the commercial organization. The MDM will work closely with the existing MDM team to identify and engage emerging Thought Leaders (eTLs) and Regional Key Opinion Leaders. Additionally, the MDM will be responsible for contributing to the development of innovative measurable metrics to define the effectiveness of KOL focused efforts. Requirements The successful MDM candidate will be an experienced oncology professional with extensive mUC therapeutic area expertise. The ideal candidate will have familiarity and/or existing relationships with mUC KOLs, previous marketing or field-based marketing experience, and have demonstrated the ability to successfully collaborate cross-functionally and within a co-promotional environment. Breadth of experience and success in multiple cross-functional roles including people leadership is strongly preferred. Specific Expectations Of Candidates Are As Follows 10+ years of experience 10+ years track record of sustained outstanding performance in oncology, with a preference for a strong background in mBC. Ideally, the candidate should have worked for top tier biotech or pharma companies that are well known for cutting edge science and innovative customer focused processes Demonstrated ability to build and sustain exceptional business relationships Must possess a broad range of leadership and professional competencies including team leadership, strategic agility, business and clinical acumen, excellent project management skills, collaborative and cross functional problem solving, exceptional communication skills, and a passion for the science of mUC/Oncology and a drive to help patients with cancer As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, relocation assistance and much more. Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. Summary The Associate Director, Regional Accounts Midwest is responsible for establishing market access for the Seagen Portfolio within targeted Commercial, Part D, PBM, Medicare MAC’s, State Medicaid, and Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs)/Health System accounts. The purpose of this role is to drive broad and deep customer relationships to deliver value in a way that leads to customer-centered initiatives, reduced access barriers, favorable payer policy, formulary attainment and appropriate design of pathways. The Associate Director is responsible for the customer engagement strategy and is expected to gain a deep understanding of priorities and future directions with assigned customer segments through business planning, account analysis and execution of strategic initiatives. This individual will provide regular updates to key internal stakeholders and provide strategic recommendations based on the application of local market knowledge, regional ecosystems, understanding of emerging pathway models and strategic account knowledge. Deep expertise and understanding of the clinical, economic, and business model dynamics driving decision-making and coverage is critical. This position requires an entrepreneurial approach in creating an engaging and sustainable customer experience to evolve by aligning customer objectives to the Seagen portfolio value proposition. The individual must have the ability to work cross-functionally, collaboratively, and possess the ability to lead effectively without formal authority. Responsibilities Establish market access for Seagen Portfolio within targeted Commercial, Part D, PBM, Medicare MAC’s, State Medicaid, and IDN/Health System accounts, including Regional/Payer/IDN policies, formularies, and pathways Identify and drive initiatives that result in increased access aligned with customer and Seagen business objectives Create and apply core engagement strategies and tactics to assigned regional customer segments, consistent with Market Access brand strategy and objectives Maintains relevance with expert knowledge and understanding of IDNs, Regional Payers, reimbursement environment and ecosystem dynamics, and provides insights, trends, competitive activity, and conditions of the market-access landscape Develops and maintains customer business plans that address customer needs and the evolving marketplace, Seagen market access brand objectives and ensures customer expectations are met or exceeded Network with various stakeholders and influencers across the account and in the regional market to develop a breadth and depth of relationships within each account to ensure an understanding of each account’s objectives, goals, drivers, and challenges Work in cross-functional efforts with internal Market Access marketing and strategy teams, Medical Affairs, HEOR, Clinical & Value Outcomes Liaisons, Patient Access & Reimbursement, Diagnostic’s, and U.S. Field Sales to develop regional strategy and tactical plans to drive account plan execution and pull-through Build a strong and credible Seagen presence in assigned segments Proactive in identifying issues and challenges with accounts. Engages with headquarters for the development of customer solutions and appropriate resources Compliantly ensures all activities are conducted with the highest degree of ethics as outlined in Seagen code of conduct policies Geographic Requirement Field-Based Business travel will be required as necessary (50% +) Qualifications 10+ years of oncology pharmaceutical experience with 5+ years inclusive of IDN and payer account management calling on National/Regional accounts 5 years of thorough knowledge of payer policy (medical and pharmacy), pathways, oncology benefit managers, distribution models (IV and oral), specialty pharmacy, IDNs, and sales and brand management Strong understanding of emerging alternative payment models in oncology, payer reimbursement, guidelines, compendium, both payer and provider clinical pathway development and implementation Strong knowledge of trends, issues, and policies impacting oncology sites of care to include both community and institutional settings Demonstrated ability to understand the local healthcare environment and apply the knowledge to opportunities within the covered accounts Demonstrated fluency in translating clinical and health economic data into customer value and the development of organizational partnerships Business acumen and ability to present complex information to large audiences Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an aptitude for building strong client relationships Strong negotiation skills with a problem-solving attitude An essential requirement of the position is to meet proof of immunization and/or vaccinations. Failure to meet all requirements may prevent an employee from performing all essential job responsibilities Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated leadership and success with existing payer relationships in a Market Access Account Director role, highly preferred Education Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Summary This position is responsible for leading the core mass spectrometry (MS) function with a staff of 8 employees within the Analytical Sciences group. This position will be responsible for developing staff, providing technical guidance, and providing strategic oversight for analytical mass spec technologies, method development, product characterization, and molecular/structural elucidation for product and process understanding. This position will interact and partner with Analytical Sciences leadership to shape the MS-based component of analytical CMC strategies such as comparability, CQA control strategy, and regulatory submissions, with the end goal of developing and registering biologics products worldwide. The candidate may author/review key technical reports, as well as relevant CMC sections to support US and EU regulatory filings from IND to BLA. The position reports to the Director of Analytical Sciences and partners closely with other functions within the Analytical Development, Bioprocess and Pharmaceutical Sciences and Data Sciences departments. Summary Seagen’s new cGMP manufacturing facility “project Launch Pad” is being built in Everett, Washington, just North of Seattle. Launch Pad will be a greenfield build encompassing end-to-end manufacturing capabilities for biologics and antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs). The Commissioning and Qualification Sr. Engineer, is responsible for leading and performing equipment validation projects for Seagen, Inc. This position supports equipment qualification for utilities by coordinating GxP equipment enrollment & commissioning, developing, reviewing, and approving equipment qualification protocols and reports. Responsible for creating, updating, and maintaining Facilities qualification SOPs and work instructions. The Sr. C&Q Engineer will provide technical, commissioning and qualification guidance as subject matter expert (SME) relating to Utilities, Facilities, change control and Operational technology implementation projects. This position reports to the Sr. Mgr. biotechnology industry Accountable for C&Q activities supporting the site Facility and Utility equipment Using Good Engineering practice, enroll and commission equipment for qualification Plan and and may coordinate activities of other personnel (Team Lead) Passion for Continuous Improvement (CI) Effective team player and strong communicator Ability to self-start and direct activities in the Description Position at Seagen Summary The Digital Engagement Strategist-CRM will be a critical member of the Customer Innovations group which develops technology-driven marketing infrastructure and best practices to meet the evolving needs of Seagen’s growing business. This subject matter expert will leverage their expertise in CRM execution and measurement to improve engagement across online experience, content strategy, email marketing, and media to raise the overall efficacy of Seagen’s marketing ecosystem. In addition to identifying the gaps and opportunities for effective and efficient data-driven marketing, the Digital Engagement Strategist-CRM will work closely with franchise marketing teams and agency partners to bridge campaign marketing from message development to execution and optimization across channels. This exciting new role is perfect for an experienced digital marketing strategist with strong technical skills in the CRM space, Salesforce products in particular, who is eager to help marketers build and evolve their ecosystems from launch. Pharmaceutical and oncology experience is preferred. This role will report to the Associate Director, Customer Innovation and be instrumental in delivering a competitive advantage and supporting our mission to deliver products that make a meaningful difference in the lives of cancer patients. Principal Responsibilities Map, evolve, and optimize the Seagen digital communications ecosystem at the enterprise and product level with a special focus on the HCP communications ecosystem between sales and NPP Drive digital conversion tactics, strategy, innovation, and standards from business case development through implementation, working with internal and external partners Lead the development and implementation of segmentation and cross-channel communication journeys, including trigger-based, machine learning, and next-best-action with brands and their agency partners Apply all types of data to inform engagement strategy, including triggers, 1st, and 3rd party data to drive targeted and personalized programs. Champion digital fluency across the commercial marketing teams, working closely with internal and external development partners to ensure best practices for usability, accessibility, conversion, and efficiency are maintained Develop best practices, KPIs, and roadmaps to evolve marketing programs within franchises and across commercial teams from the standpoint of engagement and conversion Collaborate effectively across multiple functions, including Marketing, Sales, Global Marketing Insights, Information Technology and Finance to understand key business issues, priorities and synchronize on key dependencies Drive enthusiasm for and education on the emerging trends, requirements, and best practices in CRM for a healthy and evolving marketing ecosystem Serve as a key member of the Customer Innovation team proactively seeking out opportunities to apply technical expertise to drive innovation, process improvement/optimization and/or enhance the contributions of the function Required Qualifications Minimum 5+ years digital marketing and advertising experience with 3+ years’ experience in HCP, oncology highly preferred Significant experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CRM, and Datorama with Certifications preferred Demonstrable experience with the following platforms/tools: Veeva CRM and Vault, Google Analytics 4, Google Tag Manager, Asana, SharePoint, content management and email testing systems Seasoned digital strategist with proven CRM experience mapping and optimizing opportunities for conversion via journey creation, asset development, user experience, content strategy, email marketing, measurement, testing, and optimization Experience bringing concept reviews and assets or programs through medical/legal/regulatory reviews as well as working with compliance and privacy teams. Cross Team (multiple teams) and Cross Product (multiple products) experience required, with Experience working on projects that span multiple business units. Proven experience communicating complicated marketing processes, interdependencies, platforms, and other technical topics simply and clearly for senior management and other non-technical stakeholders Strong attention to detail with the ability to think holistically in addition to attending to the most minute technical details Comfort collaborating with a diverse group of team members and stakeholders --both geographically and areas of expertise Ability to build enthusiasm for and educate less technical stakeholders on the emerging trends, requirements, and best practices for a healthy and evolving marketing ecosystem Ability to travel approximately 25% As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Summary The Director Product PM office leads a team of Product / Program PMs and is accountable for oversight for all PM activities for our commercial and pipeline products. The position reports to the Executive Director Strategic Product Management. The Director Product PMs Office ensures that the individual PMs develop, support, and execute programs, projects, and initiatives together with their assigned product teams and in close alignment within the framework of the newly established TOPS Portfolio and Systems. To achieve this, the leader works closely with our TOPS Strategy and Business department, our Strategic Product-/ and GTD Leads and functional representatives. Principal Responsibilities In charge of timely execution for all assigned programs and projects Lead the Product PM Office team, coach and guide the individual PMs to ensure they achieve their full potential in their roles in managing the operations of the Program Teams Develop and manage high-quality, integrated project and program planning, including cross-functional resource planning, financial, due diligence, and capacity assessment Advance project management best practices for development & commercial products management including timelines, risk& issues, scope, resource, cost and change management Implement stage gate appropriate processes, best practices, and tools to increase efficiency and consistency of team processes / deliverables in alignment with TOPS Portfolio and Systems tools and guidance Establish a close relationship and networks to improve and enhance team dynamics; proactively identify opportunities and remove obstacles to drive business results Liaise with cross-functional leaders in TOPS, (such as Regulatory, MSAT, Supply Operations, Manufacturing, Development, and other related functions) to align on appropriate resourcing and budget to achieve pre-defined targets and milestones Track and trace product teams & departmental goals Manages the program risk/issue lifecycle (identification, assessment, mitigation). Track and trace progress and communicate deviations to plan according to established escalation routes Support improvement initiatives when nominated as an initiative team member, SME, or initiative lead Required Qualifications Minimum 10+ years of direct pharmaceutical / biopharmaceutical experience within Technical Operations. Summary The EHSS Manager for North Creek (including B15) serves as the site responsible and advises site leadership on all EHSS aspects of the site. This role reports into the AD, EHSS Operations, supported by the overall EHSS team, and works cross-functionally with the North Creek Leadership Team. This role facilitates the site EHSS program including Seagen Framework, standards implementation, SOP development, risk assessment, site competence/capabilities, high severity risk control (duty holder), site governance, EHSS management of change, and ensures compliance to company/legal requirements. This person is responsible for the day-to-day aspects of the EHSS Management System, advising leadership, developing the culture, coaching leaders, and ensuring engaged employees within the North Creek site organization. Principal Responsibilities Implements the EHSS Standards, technical references/procedures, EHSS regulations, site permit requirements, and overall EHSS program to ensure that they are established, current, accurate, compliant, and effective Works closely with the site leadership team to drive the organization’s EHSS program, governance, and cultural initiatives to promote individual engagement and line management accountability Embed KPI/metrics, performance, EHSS Alerts, and other key EHSS initiatives within the site operations Investigate incidents, identify root cause, and implement appropriate CAPAs for EHSS incidents Ensure the effective implementation of the sites management monitoring to ensure EHSS compliance and control of risks in-line with the Seagen Control Framework Ensure the site Duty Holder program is implemented and driving continual improvement Evaluates emerging local, state, and federal regulatory requirements and updates the regulatory register, appropriate EHSS programs, and processes to ensure ongoing compliance Interfaces with federal, state, and local regulatory agencies to as the site representative and ensure EHSS compliance obligations are met. jobTitle: Executive Director, Head of Discovery Research Technology
jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. By working together with a shared dedication and diverse perspectives, we are able to reach our full potential and make a real difference in the world. Seagen is a fast-growing company and has an abundance of opportunities available for you to grow your career. Put your passion to work at Seagen and join us! Position Summary Seagen is looking for an experienced leader in Discovery Research to join our organization. This newly created role will report to the VP, Discovery Research. It will set the strategy for a team of scientific leaders responsible for discovering and developing new cancer drug technologies. This includes leading the discovery and development of novel antibody drug conjugate (ADC) technologies, including new payload mechanisms of action and conditional drug release mechanisms that improve drug potency, therapeutic efficacy, and specificity. The leader of this group will also oversee the integration of new ADC technology with novel antibody formats to advance Seagen’s ADC platform. The successful candidate will also work with senior leadership in Research to build new capabilities within the group that complements the ADC platform and expands our expertise in small molecule targeted cancer drug discovery and development. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in cancer drug discovery and will be key in enabling the organization to deliver on innovative technologies that translate to IND candidates. The role will work closely with all groups within Research, but will also work with Process Sciences, Clinical Development as well as Business Development, Corporate Strategy, and Legal to evaluate external technologies. Principal Responsibilities Lead a group of highly skilled and experienced chemists and protein scientists who are focused on targeted anticancer drug delivery Extend the research scope in areas of novel drug mechanisms of action that complement existing technologies and approaches Expand efforts towards optimizing new antibody drugs for targeted delivery and targeted cancer drug discovery and development Explore new ADC drug linkers, protein designs and drug carriers designed to enhance ADC biologic and pharmacologic properties Initiate efforts directed towards improving the therapeutic window of targeted drug delivery strategies beyond those achieved with existing delivery systems through new protein engineering and drug linker/payload strategies Collaborate with senior leaders across the Research and Translational Sciences organization to develop new targeted drug discovery strategies Position research programs and establish strong alliances with Process Sciences, Process Chemistry and other groups within Seattle Genetics to assure that promising new molecules advance expeditiously towards clinical trials Establish strategic relationships with biotech, pharma, and key academic groups that have technologies that complement the ongoing efforts within the group Contribute to appropriate Intellectual Property strategies for the protection of new discoveries Generate a robust publication record in leading journals, and present findings at key meetings Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, discovery, and cutting-edge research Required Qualifications A PhD in chemistry with significant background in organic synthesis, analytical technologies, medicinal chemistry 15-20 years’ experience in pharmaceutical industry with preclinical and clinical development activities A deep knowledge of drug discovery and development including a track record of advancing novel drugs through early phase discovery into pre-clinical and clinical development Expertise in the discovery and development of targeted drugs for cancer, including a broad understanding of the field and the challenges it faces A history in the targeted delivery of cancer drugs, including experience with antibody drug conjugates or other targeted delivery systems is a plus Proven leadership skills with a track record of leading medium to large groups and the ability to work effectively with other groups throughout the company A track record of successfully building research groups, hiring talented scientists and developing their careers Lead multidisciplinary scientific teams in developing new programs and projects, providing clear direction to research efforts that align with Research departmental goals and long term strategy Membership of scientific societies or scientific achievement awards. A distinguished publication and patent record, reflecting innovation and a series of outstanding discoveries Collaborate with the Research Leadership Team to drive discoveries in biological and pharmaceutical research; to innovate new products and novel technologies; and to build research and innovation strategies and infrastructure; Develop and execute research and early project plans that will systematically address multiple target and indication opportunities Create and execute overall chemistry plan to ensure robust, cost-effective support of company discovery and development portfolio As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, relocation assistance and much more. Summary Seagen is seeking a GxP Hard Services & Calibration Manager, within the Real Estate & Facilities (REF) organization. This management role is responsible for site Maintenance, Calibration, and associated contract services. This includes providing leadership and direction in the development of the daily operational strategy, policy, and standards for optimizing the delivery of all aspects of GxP maintenance and lab services across the R&D and Manufacturing businesses. This role will work closely with the key stakeholders to drive high-quality service performance and identify opportunities to optimize cost through efficient workplace integration and implementation. They will lead and manage a team of highly skilled, diverse SMEs in their day-to-day activities to apply innovative thinking to performance challenges across manufacturing services. This includes building the team, embedding best practice processes, managing key customer relationships, and planning efficient resource allocation across the team. EHS, Quality, Compliance, Security, Operations, Facilities, or REF Serve as the main Seagen representative in communication with suppliers, subcontractors, and planning firms regarding the site’s assets, equipment, systems, and maintenance services Works closely with Quality Assurance to develop maintenance SOPs and protocols to comply with regulatory requirements Evaluates current PM cycles and make appropriate recommendations to optimize the Maintenance Program Contributor to site Risk Assessments and Root Cause Analysis Monitors and validates performance reporting to ensure appropriate metrics are delivered by the service providers to key internal stakeholders Manages GxP service compliance adherence and identifies/escalates service risks to appropriate leadership Proactively seeking cost-effective approach without compromising the quality of service, working all aspects of the P&L to deliver viable business propositions Organized and driven approach to managing projects, GxP team members, etc. to establish and deliver on key initiatives and performance targets Mentors, teaches, and coaches GxP team members and service partner leadership on maintenance and calibration service excellence principles, best practices, techniques, and behaviors Lead a culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and customer focus. Ensures adherence to Seagen Data Integrity principles Ensures compliance against local, state, federal, country, and industry requirements. SME and point of contact for planning, scheduling of maintenance, and shutdown activities Ensures accountability for site Safety Culture Qualifications 7+ years of progressive experience with 3+ in management of technical staff within GxP environment – pharmaceutical, biotechnology or biologic industry Proven technical expertise in GxP instrument, maintenance, and CMMS Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of GxP standards & requirements Advanced knowledge of GxP production systems and equipment, automation systems and controls, power generation and UPS systems, fire alarm, and sprinkler systems Advanced knowledge of process waste treatment systems, plant water and steam chemical treatment, WFI, PW, DI water, and clean steam production and distribution systems Effectively communicates ideas through verbal and written forms, interacts constructively with peers/teams, and can seek outside resources as needed Possess a high mathematical understanding, and excellent reading, and Summary The Manager for Campus & Projects role serves as the site responsible for EHSS-related central services that support both North Creek and Canyon Park campuses and for Capex, site minor works, and FM-related projects. They will be responsible for site visitor, new employee, permit-to-work, and contractor program. This role reports to the AD, EHSS Operations, supported by the overall EHSS team, and works cross-functionally with Engineering, PMO, FM, Real Estate, and other key leadership. This role will also interact with executives across both campuses on projects and while facilitating services like waste management, Dangerous Goods Shipping, common support vendors, emergency response teams, etc. The position is also the central point of contact for projects reviews and provide direction on EHSS matters with the support of the EHSS team. This position will also work with embedded contractors and flex resources. This person is responsible for the day-to-day aspects of the centrally provided services, advising projects, ensuring effective implementation of contractor standards and Permit-to-Work oversight. Principal Responsibilities Perform review and provide EHSS guidance/advice on all projects from the PMO, site minor works, and FM/Engineering organization to ensure integration of EHSS by Design and compliance with all regulatory requirements. This is done in collaboration of the Site EHSS leads and SMEs Drive the EHSS aspects for the Contractors Management, including screening, review of site safety plans, administration of permit-to-work, ISNetworld, and day-to-day oversight at Seagen Collaborate with PMO and EHSS to ensure proper design and oversight and control in projects Lead cross-site collaborative efforts in EHSS lead/related projects including EHSS Standards implementation, LO/TO, high severity risks, etc. Lead site visitor and new employee orientation EHSS efforts with HR and Security respectively Collaborate cross-site with global SMEs and site Duty Holders driving continual improvement of maturity within the site’s capabilities Plans, develops, conducts and/or supervises contractor/vendor/visitor training programs to create proficiency in Seagen EHSS requirements and expectations. This is done in collaboration with SMEs and Site EHSS Leads Support cross-site cross-functional business reviews, assurance audits, inspections, and risk assessment activities. Assist site leads in implement corrective action promptly to ensure company and regulatory compliance Be the single point of contact for EHSS for insurance related inquiries and response Conduct process hazard analysis to identify, evaluate and control hazards. Lead advanced risk assessment efforts such as PHA and bow-tie analysis in collaboration with SME Develop and maintain departmental metrics and reports for executive leadership Qualifications 8+ years of experience in a biotechnology or Pharma R&D/laboratory environment Strong understanding of Chemical and Biological laboratory operations Experience in conducting hazard and risk assessments using various methodologies Experience in integrating EHSS, fire safety, seismic safety and other best management practices into design Familiar with pertinent federal, state, and local regulatory requirements Ability to prepare clear, concise, and accurate investigation reports Expertise in high severity risks including utilities and process safety Ability to lead without authority, work with executives, and build an engaged cross-functional team Experience managing and/or participating in multiple projects simultaneously Education Bachelor's degree in safety, environmental or related field from four-year College or university CIH, CSP, or other applicable professional certifications are desirable As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. Summary Seagen’s new cGMP manufacturing facility “project Launch Pad” is being built in Everett, Washington, just North of Seattle. Launch Pad will be a greenfield build encompassing end-to-end manufacturing capabilities for biologics and antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs). The Principal Scientist uses expert knowledge of scientific principles and concepts to solve complex manufacturing-related issues in creative and effective ways. They serve as technical advisors to senior management and build relationships between functional areas or external partners. They advise on patent or CMC regulatory strategies and develop approaches to resolve regulatory issues within project teams. They demonstrate technical proficiency, scientific creativity, collaboration with others, and independent thought to support and influence teams. They establish a long-term vision of skill sets for their functional area and prioritize/allocate effort in teams. They may supervise staff and would be responsible for driving the development of those employees. The Principal Scientist develops an external presence as a technical leader in the field by authoring journal articles, presenting posters at leading external scientific meetings, or as an invited speaker. Responsibilities Leverages scientific and technical experience in initiating new projects or bringing new scientific technologies that address important business needs. Pursues new areas of process and manufacturing Establishes business practices that advance manufacturing. Develops approaches that allow resolution of discrepancies and regulatory issues Leads inter-departmental teams and represents department in senior management meetings Guides commercial development efforts to comply with regulatory expectations. May defend position in front of regulatory agencies Thorough understanding of ICH and Regulatory Guidance and applies knowledge to drive regulatory strategies for development and CMC documents Responsible for leading drug product manufacturing technical support for internal or external manufacturing Provides technical leadership for clinical or commercial stage programs, including sub-team representation Provides person-in-plant manufacturing oversight Provides guidance for root cause investigations of process related deviations, including CAPA design and implementation Performs technical review of manufacturing related documentation Identifies and initiates process and procedural changes to improve process performance and robustness May oversee scientists or associates to deliver manufacturing activities or initiatives. Motivates and supports the career development and technical growth of direct reports Authors technical summaries, white papers, or publications (internal or external) which support department’s policies and goals Qualifications Strong technical experience within relevant development and/or manufacturing technologies and unit operations. Preferably experience with equipment utilized in commercial cGMP manufacturing facilities Demonstrated expertise in drug product biologics manufacturing Good knowledge of structured methodologies for process design, scale-up/down models, process control strategies, process validation and continuous process verification The ability to work effectively in small matrix teams in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and a high level of urgency Highly motivated with the ability to work independently as well as on cross-functional and cross-site teams Experience working with Contract Manufacturing Organizations Strong communication skills and computer literacy Education B.S. and 17+ years; M.S. and 14+ years Ph.D. and 5+ years As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Under the general direction of the Seagen Commercial Diagnostics Leader, this position will plan and execute all aspects of the organization’s Pathology / Diagnostic Market and Access strategy. This position will have a great deal of autonomy and the candidate must be self-driven to deliver results. The primary responsibility for this role will be to liaise with pathology groups, diagnostic groups, and key stakeholders of reference laboratories to build a core diagnostic foundation for our current and future pipeline products. The Oncology Diagnostic Liaison will report to the Commercial Diagnostics Leader. Principal Responsibilities Under the general direction of the Seagen Commercial Diagnostics Leader, plan and execute all aspects of the organization’s Pathology / Diagnostic Market and access strategy for the assigned region Develop key messaging and education tactics within the assigned region to positively impact pathology targets Be the primary liaison with regional pathology groups, diagnostic groups and key stakeholders of reference laboratories and key institutional accounts to build and maintain a core diagnostic foundation for current and future pipeline products Educate pathologists on new therapy driven emerging biomarkers of interest and utility of said biomarkers (pre and post approval) Proactively and independently establish laboratory relationships and connections within the regional pathology and oncologist community to increase understanding of ordering the right test, at the right time, with the right key protocols in place for better patient identification and diagnosis Attend diagnostic advisory boards and pathology related congresses as needed to network, influence, and generally increase awareness and understanding of diagnostic testing in relation to the therapeutic products offered by Seagen Actively monitor the latest developments within the therapeutic area and be able to effectively discuss all aspects of the patient biopsy, tissue journey, and the technical challenges along the tumor and patient diagnosis. Frequent travel is required Qualifications 5+ years of experience and demonstrated, in-depth knowledge of the Diagnostic and Hematopathology Marketplace Experience working with and training pathologists on new emerging data and information concerning accurate IHC testing and reporting Must have deep laboratory experience or an understanding of the flow of work within an academic / community institution, as well as national/regional reference labs Must be able to develop and execute a territory/regional plan of action to impact pathology targets and drive education with key messaging within assigned territory/region Must have experience presenting and articulating educational and complex information to key stakeholders / decision makers, including but not limited to pathologists, oncologists, lab techs, c-suite executives, etc. Understanding of testing methodologies with IHC, FLOW, FISH, PCR, and NGS (Next Generation Sequencing) preferred Pharmaceutical experience in oncology preferred A basic understanding of hospital EMRs flow of work and Laboratory LIS preferred Passionate about making a difference for oncology patients Ability to think creatively, convert ideas into action, and act with a sense of urgency Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Embraces cross-functional collaboration with all internal and external customers Embraces critical thinking and different opinions to arrive at optimum solutions Embraces and fosters a high level of focus, discipline, character, integrity, and leadership Strong knowledge of information technology necessary to operate effectively with company systems and programs Must have a reliable mode of transportation and a clean driving record This is a field-based position and frequent travel is required Education Bachelor’s degree is required. Summary The BioProcess Development Department at Seagen seeks a Sr. Scientist / Principal Scientist (level depending on experience), who will lead early- and or late-phase clinical programs and provide technical input to cross-functional projects and initiatives within Process Sciences, as well as lead Technology Development efforts within Purification Development. The ideal candidate will have expertise in and a deep understanding of all common downstream unit operations, including chromatographic and filtration- based separation techniques, as well strong critical thinking skills, and an ability to design, execute, and draw conclusions from experimental studies. This individual will author regulatory submissions and will lead product characterization studies as required to support clinical program development. The Senior / Principal Scientist will interface cross-functionally with Product Supply and Process Sciences through participation in CMC project teams and will provide supervision and technical leadership to direct and matrixed reports within BioProcess Development. This individual will contribute to and help foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and scientific excellence within the organization. Principal Responsibilities Serve on early- and/or late-stage clinical program CMC teams as purification lead, supporting product development and ensuring successful acceptance of global regulatory filings Manage process development activities and tech transfer to support internal/external manufacturing, as required May provide technical support as a Process Sciences SME for Commercial programs, as required Interact closely with cross-disciplinary project teams to advance technology development efforts in support of clinical development, including Analytical Sciences, Quality, Regulatory and other BioProcess Development groups Lead intradepartmental projects and initiatives involving other contributors Lead and perform hands-on work in the small-scale purification development laboratory working with state-of-the art instrumentation, such as TECAN and AKTA systems Provide subject-area expertise in BioProcess and CMC development, and mentor other group members in all aspects of core group work Lead viral validation studies as required to support CMC development Author high-quality regulatory submissions and technical reports; independently prepare and present experimental findings at department, project team, and senior management meetings Supervise staff in direct and matrixed reporting capacities, and provide appropriate feedback, guidance, and mentoring Qualifications Expertise in and a deep understanding of all common downstream unit operations, including chromatographic and filtration- based separation techniques, such as tangential flow filtration, dead-end filtration, and all types of protein chromatography commonly used in BioProcess Development Subject area expertise in one or more areas of technical focus, such as TECAN / robocolumn separations, mechanistic modeling, viral clearance validation, etc. Demonstrated capacity to resolve complex scientific problems with appropriately designed experimentation, including practical experience in experimental approaches. An understanding of viral clearance validation in downstream bioprocess development is required An understanding of Design of Experiment (DoE) methodology, as well as experience using statistical analysis tools, such as JMP, is required Prior experience with tech transfer is required Demonstrated experience and success working in cross-functional roles, with a sophisticated understanding of CMC clinical development, beyond the Purification perspective Prior experience performing process characterization (PC) studies, process performance qualification (PPQ), and other late-stage development activities would be advantageous. Prior experience preparing regulatory filings including IND/IMPD applications, amendments, and comparability studies is required. Summary We are seeking a Principal Scientist with exceptional technical proficiency, scientific creativity, critical thinking, and self-motivation to join the In Vivo Biology team within the Core Research and Technology (CRT) Biology division. Our company culture places a premium on scientific excellence, innovation, and teamwork to develop translational models that have a meaningful impact on the development of biopharmaceuticals and the treatment of cancer. You will be part of a vibrant and experienced group leading the scientific understanding of ADC therapeutic activity and tumor biology. You will lead and develop a team of research associates and scientists responsible for the conduct of key in vivo pharmacology studies required to advance novel therapeutics into the clinic, while also contributing significantly to driving innovation. A strong ability to motivate, retain and recruit high-quality scientists is a key expectation of the role. You will use your expertise to develop new animal models and experimental strategies to explore foundational science questions in support of the discovery and development of novel, safe, and effective therapeutic candidates. Your communication skills at all levels of interaction must be excellent. You will contribute to scientific expertise broadly across Research & Development, with significant potential for broadening your career. study design that maximizes scientific results with minimal resources Collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout Research to explore fundamental questions regarding ADC activity and tumor biology Design and implement strategies to develop novel translationally-relevant animal models when needed to support the development of therapeutics in the pipeline or answer foundational science questions Ensure a strong ethical basis for all experimentation, maintaining full compliance with all appropriate regulations and being a strong advocate for the 3Rs Participate in the In Vivo Biology leadership team working to develop a forward-facing vision for In Vivo Biology, and support the implementation of this vision Represent Seagen in the external scientific environment Required Qualifications A Ph.D. in Cancer Biology, Pharmacology, Immunology, Biological Sciences, or related discipline with 5-8 years of postdoctoral experience and 5+ years of supervisory or leadership experience, or a B.A/B.S with 11+ years of related laboratory experience and 5+ years of supervisory or leadership experience Strong scientific track record and ethical leadership in animal experimentation Proven success in the scientific investigation of fundamental biology questions, either through scientific publications or drug development experience Strong leadership and management skills, excellent verbal, and written communication skills Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and problem-solving skills Ability to work in a matrix environment, prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously, integrate cross-functional issues, and balance competing priorities effectively Preferred Qualifications Experience with implementing advanced, clinically-relevant, rodent oncology models Working knowledge in the function of the immune system and experience in experimental models of antitumor immunity As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Summary Seagen is seeking a high-performing Senior/Principal Scientist to join our MSAT Labs and Innovation team in Bothell, WA. This role will be responsible for identifying and implementing downstream purification technical innovation that will contribute to future manufacturing development and improvement. The individual will independently lead/execute downstream purification laboratory studies to support global manufacturing and new technology evaluation. The ideal candidate will have a high level of technical expertise in common downstream purification unit operations, including chromatography and filtration based separation, including scale-up/down methodology. This is a leadership opportunity where this role will lead projects, troubleshoot technical challenges, and apply new, innovative technologies to manufacturing. The final level of this position will be based on the candidate’s qualifications. Principal Responsibilities Leads identification, evaluation, and development of innovative manufacturing technologies within the field of purification Design and execute purification experiments in support of process transfer, troubleshooting, continuous improvement Works hands-on in the laboratory for design of experiments, execution, data analysis and data interpretation Collaborate with MSAT team to create and foster a scientific climate of excellence to achieve business goals Supports process deviations, assesses product impact, prepares technical reports and proposes process solutions and improvements Interfacing with Development and manufacturing sites for process data analysis & mapping in order to anticipate potential risks and opportunities for improvements supporting next generation manufacturing processes Adhere to Good Documentation Practices for documenting experimental work using an ELN Maintain clear and timely records of experimental work and be able to organize, report, and clearly communicate results within the Technical Operations function and to cross-functional teams Serve as downstream process subject matter expert on cross-functional teams and effectively communicate results, progress, and plans Present at external scientific meetings, develop research for publication in scientific journals, and develop Seagen intellectual property Required Qualifications Outstanding record of accomplishment in areas of purification bioprocess development, improvement and validation Knowledge of purification techniques (depth filtration, column chromatography, virus retentive filtration, tangential flow filtration, etc.) Hands-on experience with operation and maintenance of bench through pilot scale chromatography systems and TFF equipment Knowledge of protein chemistry and analytical techniques (HPLC, SDS-PAGE, Western blotting, etc.) Strong scientific and technical experience within purification development and/or manufacturing technologies and unit operations. Preferably experience with equipment utilized in commercial cGMP manufacturing facilities Good knowledge of structured methodologies for process design, scale-up/down models, process modeling, process control strategies, process validation and continuous process verification The ability to work effectively in small matrix teams in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and a high level of urgency. Highly motivated with the ability to work independently as well as on cross-functional and cross-site teams The candidate must demonstrate high levels of integrity. jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. Summary Seagen’s new cGMP manufacturing facility “project Launch Pad” is being built in Everett, Washington, just North of Seattle. Launch Pad will be a greenfield build encompassing end-to-end manufacturing capabilities for biologics and antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs). The Principal Scientist is part of a team of highly skilled Scientists responsible for technical and scientific support to manufacturing of Seagen products, whether manufactured internally or at contract manufacturing organizations (CMO’s). The incumbent co-ordinates and collaborates with peers from Development functions to ensure new products are robust and well understood. The Principal Scientist will play a leadership role in process and equipment specification, technology transfers, process validation and GMP manufacturing technical support. The incumbent leads process optimization and CMC projects. The Principal Scientist will provide technical and scientific leadership as subject matter expert (SME) relating to manufacturing processes, change control, scale-down/up studies, technology implementation projects and process optimization. Principal Responsibilities Acts as the primary technical drug substance lead/contact for CMO’s and internal manufacturing sites and drug substance/products Provides technical and scientific leadership as subject matter expert (SME) relating to technology transfers, manufacturing processes, complex deviations, technical troubleshooting, CAPA design and implementation, process monitoring, change control and process optimization Works cross-functionally supporting Development and Manufacturing as well as CMO’s to introduce new and improved manufacturing technologies/processes Authors and reviews technical reports, manufacturing documents, regulatory submissions, and publications Advises and participates in the assessment and selection of CMOs considering both technical and business elements Specifies and selects key unit operations/manufacturing equipment for new installations/sites Providing guidance for comprehensive facility fit assessments and gap analysis for the relevant part of GMP manufacturing Partnering with other functions to apply e.g., modelling tools ensuring that scale-down/up and characterization of manufacturing processes is robust and scientifically sound leading to a predictable and highly consistent performance and a well characterized process Identifies and initiates process and procedural changes to improve process performance, robustness, productivity, safety, efficiency, and compliance Supports and mentors Scientists, Engineers, and Research Associates Required Qualifications Demonstrated expert knowledge in Biologics Drug Substance manufacturing Strong scientific and technical experience within relevant manufacturing process technologies and unit operations. Experience of commercial cGMP manufacturing Experience with drafting and reviewing regulatory submissions, responding to agency information requests, and fronting agency audits The ability to work effectively and lead small matrix and cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and a high level of urgency. Highly motivated with the ability to work independently as well as on cross-functional and cross-site teams Able to effectively establish and maintain productive relationships with senior technical staff within and outside of Seagen The candidate must demonstrate high levels of integrity. Key competencies are management of complexity, driving for results, problem-solving and collaborating cross-functionally Strong communication skills and computer literacy are essential Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Bioengineering, Chemical Engineering, or related field with 17+ years of experience of pharmaceutical development or manufacturing. Alternatively, a Master’s with 14+ years of experience or PhD with 5+ years of experience. As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. Summary The Principal Scientist uses expert knowledge of scientific principles and concepts to solve complex drug development problems in creative and effective ways. They serve as technical advisor to sr. management and build relationship between functional areas or external partners. They advise on patent or CMC regulatory strategies and develop approaches to resolve regulatory issues within CMC team. They demonstrate technical proficiency, scientific creativity, collaboration with others, and independent thought to support and influence teams. They establish a long-term vision of skill sets for functional areas and prioritize/allocate effort in team. They may supervise staff and would be responsible for driving the development of those employees. They develop an external presence as technical leader in the field by authoring journal articles, presenting posters at leading external scientific meetings, or as invited speaker. Pursues new areas of process and assay development, and manufacturing Establishes business practices that advance drug development and manufacturing. Develops approaches that allow resolution of discrepancies and regulatory issues Leads inter-departmental teams and represents department in senior management meetings Guides development efforts to comply with regulatory expectations. May defend position in front of regulatory agencies Thorough understanding of ICH and Regulatory Guidance and applies knowledge to drive regulatory strategies for development and CMC documents Creates a long-term vision of the skillsets needed for the group and build group towards that vision (either recruit or train). Motivates and supports the career development and technical growth of direct reports Authors technical summaries, white papers or publications (internal or external) which support department’s policies and goals May present at national/international forums or chair and/or help organize external meetings in area of expertise Technical advisor to senior management on risks to project Leads formulation assessment for early-stage and/or late-stage antibody and antibody-drug conjugate programs independently. May develop more complex formulations for late-stage or commercial programs Independently leads studies used to support formulation development, including evaluations of stability, clinical in-use, and forced degradation characterization Leads drug product manufacturing and lyophilization processes development for early-stage and/or late-stage programs independently. May lead more complex drug product process development and characterization activities for late-stage or commercial programs Independently supports technology transfer activities and oversees drug product manufacturing activities Able to oversee multiple development projects Represents formulation and drug product sciences on CMC teams and other cross-functional teams Leads group initiatives and technology development projects independently Required Qualifications Degree in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biochemistry, Biological Sciences, Chemical Engineering or related discipline B.S. and 17+ years; M.S. and 14+ years; Ph.D. and 5+ years' experience At least half of industry experience performing protein formulation development, analytical and biophysical characterization or DP process development including lyophilization processes development, technology transfer to CMOs, DP CMO management Demonstrated protein formulation development or DP process development experience for clinical stage programs or commercial programs Excellent understanding of analytical and biophysical protein characterization, for example, HPLC, CE, icIEF, CEX, SDS-PAGE, AUC, DSC, CD, FTIR, Fluorescence Broad subject matter expertise in multiple technical areas of formulation or DP process development; working knowledge of both 5+ years supervisory or leadership experience Proven ability to lead cross-functional development teams Extensive experience in support regulatory submission Proven ability to provide strategic contribution Preferred Qualifications Hands-on experience of DP administered via multiple routes (e.g. SubQ) Proven experience authoring or reviewing global regulatory submission sections. Statistical software use, such as JMP As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Launch Pad will be a greenfield build encompassing end-to-end manufacturing capabilities for biologics and antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs). The QC Analyst III - LIMS will support the implementation and administration of the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS), including creating test method templates, logging batches, building environmental monitoring sampling points and schedules, and running LIMS reports. This position is also responsible for training other LIMS users and troubleshooting system issues. The QC Analyst III – LIMS position is a collaborative role that works closely with other Seagen sites and corporate Quality to define LIMS business processes, author and revise SOPs, and ensure alignment across sites. This role will also participate in LIMS development and validation studies, and continuous improvement initiatives. This position reports to the Senior Manager, QC Laboratory Operations. Principal Responsibilities Create and manage LIMS testing templates (e.g. batch templates for facility monitoring, manufacturing, in-process testing, raw materials, and release testing) Log batches for raw materials, manufacturing intermediates, drug substance, and drug product Build environmental monitoring sampling points, sampling schedules, and report templates in LIMS Create advanced templates for LIMS calculations and ELN functions Work collaboratively with other Seagen sites and LIMS administrators to: Author and revise procedures and work instructions Train QC, QA, and Manufacturing personnel Troubleshoot system issues Execute validation studies Identify and implement system improvements Work closely with Manufacturing, Planning, QC product leads, and QC test labs to ensure that templates and batches are available within project and manufacturing schedule timelines Act as site subject matter expert on LIMS function and administration during audits and inspections Evening, weekend, or on-call work may be required Expected Qualifications 5+ years relevant experience Bachelor's degree or higher in relevant discipline Knowledge of GMP requirements for data management and data integrity Experience with common QC laboratory equipment and test methods Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively across departments and between sites Preferred Qualifications Experience with software validation Knowledge of biopharmaceutical facility environmental monitoring programs GMP quality systems experience, including change control, good documentation practices, and training requirement As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Summary Under the supervision of Associate Director, Assay Development and Transfer, the Research Associate III will perform tasks related to specimen accessioning, QC, H&E staining, immunohistochemistry, and in-situ hybridization on automated platforms, aliquoting, DNA/RNA extractions, molecular testing including, but not limited to, Next Gen Sequencing and other tasks as needed. The RAIII will prepare reagents for use, perform data entry, check for any discrepancies between labels, assist with validations processes for bringing on new tests and/or instruments/equipment. They will write validation and other reports and may contribute to scientific publications. The RAIII will function with a high degree of independence in daily work, and design and interpret complex experiments with guidance. They will have a general understanding of project scope. They will provide experimental expertise, support to others on joint projects, provide data and partial (co-) authorship on group reports. They may mentor other employees or interns and may provide some direction to others. Candidate must possess a commitment to excellence and quality for patients.
