The Sr. Building Engineer will be expected to oversee the management of external maintenance contractors, with an overriding focus on continuous improvement and delivery. On a daily basis you will be responsible for regulatory compliance and building maintenance activities. This is alongside the continual development of building maintenance standards across the campus. This position will be assigned to projects that are complex in nature where judgment is required in resolving problems and in making routine recommendations. You will assist or perform repairs on facilities equipment as required while targeting Best in Class results of site facility services. This role will require the standard work and non-routine activities performed on each asset are conducted safely, maintained appropriately, and allow for the efficient production of high-quality product. This is an on-site full time non-exempt position that reports to the Sr. Engineering Manager. Principal Responsibilities Act as primary technical advisor, coordinating and supporting the Building Engineer’s activities across the campus Responsible for the establishment and delivery of maintenance programs / schedules, (planned, condition, inspections and reactive) that are aligned to and support the Seagen Maintenance Strategy Performs repairs on facilities equipment as required and provides technical assistance to other departments for troubleshooting Responsible for mechanical service calls and in-house repairs throughout company facilities Assists in the identification and development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) for routine tasks Advanced knowledge and skill in performing and overseeing vendor maintenance programs and repairs related to Cold rooms, PM Steam Boilers, Hot water boilers, Chillers, and Cooling Towers Advanced Knowledge and skilled in the operations, troubleshooting and repairs of mechanical/Utility systems, ie Electrical, Emergency Generators, HVAC, Compress Lab Gas distribution Automation support of utilities Maintains computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS) and building automation systems (BAS). Water Management Plan Knowledge Drawing Management Engineering Supports inspections of equipment to ensure that it is fit-for purpose, safe, compliant. SME for CRs Manage Compress Lab Gas System Engineering Standards Control Proactive Preventative Maintenance Provides “on call” response to building system and equipment alarms on a rotating basis in conjunction with other Facilities Department personnel Required Qualifications Bachelors/Technical Degree in engineering studies or 6+ years’ relevant experience performing equipment maintenance in a laboratory setting including mechanical and electrical work Person must be highly self-motivated and flexible individual who can manage multiple priorities and work within a fast-paced lab and office environment Excellent written and oral communication skills Must have a high level of interpersonal skills to assist others Must be a self-starter and work independently Experienced AutoCAD and Revit user Organizational skills are required Refrigeration Operating Engineer License or Grade 3 Steam Engineer License, or able to obtain within 6mo Ability to complete the second level of a Building Operator Certification program within 6 months of job acceptance Preferred Qualifications Introductory and annual refresher GMP Training Introductory and annual refresher GLP Training Ability to work in a laboratory environment. Must be able to lift 30 to 50 pounds and routinely work from a ladder. Specific knowledge of building systems as assigned Awareness of details within EPA, OSHA, ISO, FDA and other relevant safety regulations All FA-Category SOP’s Previous experience in biotech, pharmaceutical or health care industry preferred but not required BA degree in Engineering, Mechanical or equivalent preferred Engineer License and/or certifications preferred As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. Summary The Director / Sr. Director of Strategic Sourcing and Procurement (SSP) will lead strategic sourcing, contracting, and supplier management across Technical Operations (TOPS) which includes Product Supply, Quality, and Technical Development. The candidate will build and maintain long-term relationships with key suppliers, negotiate contracts, and drive value-enhancing and risk-mitigating initiatives. The ideal candidate will have direct strategic sourcing and technical operations experience in the biopharmaceutical industry (and/or pharma). This position partners closely with Seagen’s central procurement team and other key stakeholders to ensure that external sourcing and management of key suppliers is executed at a world-class level. The Director / Sr. Director of SSP will bring team and organizational leadership as a member of Product Supply’s leadership team. Principal Responsibilities Hire, develop, and lead a team of procurement professionals focused on helping TOPS achieve its financial and strategic goals In collaboration with Seagen’s other Procurement teams, determine global strategy for supplier management in line with business and customer needs Make sound data driven decisions regarding supplier performance, contractual obligations, and long-term partnerships Partner with key functional areas e.g., corporate finance, other procurement teams, legal/contracts, accounts payable and human resources to plan, manage, report and drive efficiencies and alignment related to all aspect’s TOPS contract delivery metrics. This includes both ongoing management of contract demand as well as forecasting and long-range planning in concert with the overarching business strategy Partner with TOPS stakeholders, central Procurement and Legal teams to develop Master Supply/Service Agreements (MSA), Letters of Intent (LOI), Statements of Work (SOW), etc. Assist in the identification of potential suppliers and develop/co-develop request for proposal (RFP) packages. Engage with respondents throughout RFP process to ensure clear understanding of requirements and development of high-quality proposals Navigate challenging supplier performance issues as needed via direct business-to-business discussions, and via contractual/legal escalation pathways as needed Develop and own initiatives and projects towards financial and supply performance targets in terms of value, reliability, compliance, and complexity reduction (cost reductions/avoidance, supplier/portfolio rationalization, reliability, compliance and sustainability) Proactively look for ways to mitigate our risk profile via contract negotiations, close monitoring of supplier performance, and supporting performance improvement initiatives Routinely scout opportunities; stay on top of the evolving supplier landscape across multiple categories; develop and maintain up-to-date supplier databases that are review-ready at any given time Balances the interest of multiple internal and external stakeholders while effectively leading change in business strategy and processes Qualifications Minimum of 15 years of pharmaceutical or biopharmaceutical industry experience within a sourcing/contracting or procurement function. Additional experience within manufacturing operations, supply chain, process development or MSAT is a plus Strong experience in developing and negotiating contracts with external suppliers; working knowledge of standard terms and conditions Comprehensive knowledge of one or more relevant industry sectors and its key suppliers; broad knowledge in additional sectors is a plus Ability to attract, motivate, and develop high performing teams Must have excellent communication and collaboration skills Must have solid analytical skills and financial acumen Must be proficient in Microsoft Office suite, presentation development, database development, charting and trending, and basis statistics Ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-changing dynamic environment Heightened level of cultural awareness and sensitivity Ability to travel within and outside of the US; occasional periods of frequent travel Fluency in English, some proficiency in French, German, Italian, or Spanish is a plus Education PhD with 6-8 years of experience MS or MBA with 8-12 years of experience Bachelors with 12+ years of experience is desired As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. To be successful in this role you will need to be flexible, self-motivated, detail-oriented, and provide exceptional support to the Chief Executive Officer. You’ll be a positive and professional role model in the organization and possess strong decision-making skills, be forward-thinking, collaborative, and have a reputation for problem-solving and troubleshooting in an evolving business environment. This role will help lead and guide the administrative community and will require a high degree of discretion around sensitive information. Principal Responsibilities Primary support to the Chief Executive Officer. Responsible for creating and maintaining the rhythm of the business through proactive planning and execution of administrative support to ensure a seamless experience for leadership and all employees within the division Manage and maintain CEO’s complex calendar on a daily, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis to ensure accurate scheduling and prioritization. initiatives as needed Qualifications 10+ years in an administrative role supporting senior management in a fast-paced, technology-driven environment Has worked with publicly traded companies in the C suite Maintains a high degree of discretion and confidentiality Ability to apply knowledge of the business and integrate into daily tasks to achieve successful outcomes in cross-functional projects and activities Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills are required Ability to prioritize work and deliver projects completed and on time while facing multiple distractions and interruptions appropriate sense of urgency to situations or events that require a quick response or turnaround Ability to independently problem-solve to quickly resolve issues to maintain business continuity The Summary Seagen is seeking a Sr. Facilities Coordinator within the Facilities Management, function of the Real Estate and Facilities (REF) organization. This role will be responsible for delivering exceptional services that transform the workplace experience for Seagen’s employees and guests by supporting operational activities in the areas of Facilities Management training, operations reporting, vendor management & risk, soft and hard services, and move/relocation support to the FM Portfolio. This role will collaborate with other REF & Seagen teams such as Service Development, Occupancy Planning, Soft Services, Environmental Health & Safety, Finance, Learning & Development and IT to proactively ensure that expected service levels are achieved. This person will possess a highly collaborative approach to business with strong customer service, interpersonal, and influencing skills. This role will report to the Regional Facilities Manager, Internationals. Principal Responsibilities In coordination with Site Minor Works (SMW), provide updates on facility-related projects using Smartsheets, and other software tools as directed Maintain Facilities Management Playbooks, Team Site, Newsletter and SharePoint –Update and ensure accurate records and official documentation for the site/s that support operations, including, but not limited to moves/reconfigurations, events, reception, and building operations. Support FM Leadership by submitting contracts for legal review and purchase orders for service contracts, materials/stock, preventative, and reactive work Serve as the POC for the ISNET vendor management system activities including vendor enrollment, verifying contacts and insurance information; generate reports; Verify accurate completion of contract and certificates of insurance information prior to contract or PO request submission Monitor and maintain the facility maintenance work order system and prepare monthly reports for facilities management team on status and trending of work orders proactive & reactive. Coordinates the delivery of site amenities which may include wellness, food services, transportation, and acts as the site key point of contact Provides backup coordination and support for events, meetings, and cultural café. Assists with special events, including set-up and break-down of cafeteria, conference and multi-purpose rooms as required Helps coordinate space management and planning activities including analyzing moves for minimal disruption; move coordination; space inventory; space allocation tracking; specifying set-ups; maximizing space utilization Maintains facility furniture assets, floor plans and seating assignments and facilities the MAC functions for all sites to include moving and arranging furniture or equipment as applicable. Inspects the facility and other structures to detect malfunctions or necessary repairs and repairs or submits proactive tickets for technicians or building engineers as required Identify opportunities for improved operation and service excellence; resolve work order requests as assigned related to FM operational efficiency and other general soft services facility related concerns Conducts daily building walkthroughs and perform minor repairs to ensure a clean, organized, and fit for purpose working environment Actively support an environment of teamwork, cooperation, performance excellence, and personal success. Complies with safety and health rules Perform other job-related duties as assigned that may include but are not limited to reception and guest support, mail and courier services, office supplies and equipment maintenance, landlord relations and management of building access passes, safety, and security support Qualifications Essential Requirements: Associates or Bachelor of Arts, Business or Science or equivalent experience Minimum of 4 years’ experience in a customer service capacity Minimum of 3 years industry experience within prior experience in Facility Management, Vendor Management, Hospitality, Soft Services and / or Operations Ability to lift or move furniture and equipment up to 25lbs Preferred Requirements Prior experience in facilities, property management, hospitality, or related field preferred. Must have strong background in people and skills, and supplier performance management, attention to detail and a passion for excellent customer service Must have an outgoing, but tempered personality and be comfortable working with senior management, shows tact, discretion and good judgment in handling sensitive and confidential matters and documentation Works well within a team environment and individually, self-directed with a high energy level, track record of initiative, integrity and good judgement Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate up, down, and across the business Exceptional organization, planning, problem solving and execution abilities. Good judgement - decision making Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and facilities ticketing systems. Available to work overtime, both at the beginning and end of day, sometimes with limited notice. Knowledge about local occupational health and safety requirements, critical facilities and vendor management for specialized services is advantageous Ability to gather data, assess situations and quickly develop solutions with a strong analytical/financial aptitude Critical thinking, using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Summary Seagen is seeking a Sr. Instrument Technician to support the Scientific Services Department within the Facilities Management group of the Real Estate & Facilities (REF) organization. This position will support the senior instrument technician and could work within other disciplines in the REF organization. The Senior Instrument Technician will be accountable to utilize their skills and experience to achieve the safe and accurate completion of tasks at their assigned location with minimal supervision. This position is responsible for performing advanced calibrations, maintenance, repairs, installations, troubleshooting and documentation of instruments used on process control systems, analytical labs and utility building systems for manufacturing and testing. The Senior Instrument Technician is expected to work to maintain equipment in a qualified state of control by following site SOP’s and the Change Management process. This position will work with cross functional departments on improvement initiatives, Deviation Investigations and CAPA. This role reports to the GMP Equipment Supervisor, Scientific Services Management. Principal Responsibilities Timely completion of tasks and work orders with appropriate documentation according to standard operating procedures, applicable standards, guidelines, practices, and policies Perform hands on advanced calibrations, diagnostics, repairs and maintenance of industrial process control instruments or systems, laboratory instruments and analyzers, and utilities in a cGMP/cGXP environment, while minimizing instrumentation and equipment downtime, ensuring that manufacturing operations and functional support departments are enabled to successfully make, assess and release Seagen drug products 24/7 Programming/configuration of microprocessor-based equipment (PLCs, DCS, smart devices, critical monitoring, data loggers, etc.) Work to be completed in a safe manner according to planning and predefined schedules with minimal impact to production while complying with GMP, SOP, CFR and Seagen regulations Interact with peers and clients in manufacturing, maintenance, analytical labs and contracted services Perform general labor duties and may work in a variety of locations and jobs Lead and train lower level crafts persons in skills necessary to become proficient Lead projects and meetings Coordinate various equipment OEM and vendor activities Conduct training, communications, and escort of equipment contractors, OEM and vendors Lead incident and deviation investigations Provide documentation support for the equipment Calibration & Maintenance program (commissioning, MEF equipment and task enrolment, equipment labeling) Complete various quality system and CMMS documentation, assist with the equipment enrollment process into the CMMS and Starlims (equipment, parts, procedures, measurement data templates, job plans, data sheet, etc.) Author and revise facility SOPs Safe operation of tools and shop equipment, housekeeping and safe execution of work in the field Demonstrated proficiency to monitor, trend and analyze data to make corrections or recommendations Lead systems start-up, new installations Assistance with identification, purchase, and organization of spare parts Initiate and champion instrument or equipment related Change Requests (CR) Site technical Authority Support site audits Maintain Remote Monitoring equipment Participate in On-Call rotations and available for after-hours facility and manufacturing support and work outside of established shift hours upon short notice such, as evenings and weekends Qualifications Essential Requirements: High School Diploma or GED and one of the following Associate degree or completion of an Instrumentation or Industrial Electronics (2-year) curriculum at a technical school with 5+ years of work experience 5+ years of instrumentation/calibration experience in manufacturing or biopharmaceutical in a GXP regulated environment field Ability to lift up to 50 lbs Organized and mechanically inclined Effective team player and strong communicator Ability to self-start and direct activities in the absence of the supervisor Must have a strong knowledge of GxP equipment compliance requirements Must be able to follow detailed instructions and procedures Must have a strong knowledge of MS office applications Ability to read and interpret P&IDs, engineering documents and schematics As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. Summary Seagen’s new cGMP manufacturing facility “project Launch Pad” is being built in Everett, Washington, just North of Seattle. Launch Pad will be a greenfield build encompassing end-to-end manufacturing capabilities for biologics and antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs). The Commissioning and Qualification Sr. Manager serves as a site functional manager and resource for the commissioning and qualification activities supporting facility and utility equipment. The incumbent will resolve technical and process challenges in a regulated GxP environment. This person will, on occasion draft, review and execute documents and procedures related to guidance and controlled documents as necessary. This individual will also utilize C&Q experience and expertise to draft, review, and execute documentation and activities. As the Commissioning and Qualification Sr. Manager, the professional will lead a team of commissioning and qualification engineers per schedule and in alignment with GMP compliance and Quality Assurance Requirements. Principal Responsibilities Proven track record of Audit Preparation and Readiness with Quality, Compliance and Safety Proven knowledge of applying Risk Based Approach for C&Q activities within the C&Q actions Manages risk, concerns and issues for tiered escalation from the site to the management as required Ensures Good Documentation and Good Engineering Practices, GDP and GEP Partner as a Leader within the site Cross Functional Team to support site operations and C&Q daily responsibilities Responsible to review technical requirement specifications and project documentation supporting C&Q protocols such as URS, FS, P&IDs, Isometrics, FAT, SAT, Installation and Operation Commissioning tests, IQ and OQs Ensures adherence and compliance to pre-start up safety checks, LOTO and site safety programs Functional area participant to support C&Q deliverables such as system impact assessments, establishing system boundary drawings, traceability matrix Manage oversight of 3rd party organizations with inspections, document redline, review of C&Q supporting documentation Participate in change controls, deviations, investigations, corrective/preventive actions, root cause analysis to drive timely close out Required Qualifications Bachelor of Science, Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent technical training plus 10+ years related experience 7+ years experience within GxP environment 5+ years experience in Commissioning and Qualification or Engineering Management Demonstrated knowledge of GMP industry regulations Preferred Qualifications American Society of Quality Certification or equivalent RAPS Certification GMP Certification As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total jobTitle: Senior Manager Data and AI Platforms
jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. Summary The Data Strategy, Science, & Solutions team’s (DSS&S) mission is to provide quality data, visualization, data science, & machine learning capabilities to enable Seagen to make impactful decisions, generate actionable insights, & create new patient value. Our intent is to empower everyone at Seagen to use data to make decisions and take action in support of a Seagen’s mission to improve treatment outcomes for patients. We are a data product focused, dynamic and agile team within Seagen’s Global IT organization. We have an open, respectful, and empowering culture, and you will have plenty of opportunities to learn and grow. The primary mission of the Sr. Manager of Data and AI Platforms is to lead the design, development, and execution of the Seagen Self-Service Data Platform in support of our mission to empower data teams across Seagen to deliver best-in-class data products. This role will be responsible for guiding the day-to-day technical delivery of cross-functional engineers, as you lead the development of our core self-service data platform and its supporting services, guided by principles of Agile, DevSecOps, and continuous innovation. The Sr. Manager, Data and AI Platforms is a key leader on our team helping to build a quality-driven culture to adhere to the highest standards of security, usability, performance, and scalability while optimizing cost and innovating with emerging data and analytics technologies. Responsibilities Guiding development work, removing blockers, and making product and technical decisions to help your team effectively meet its goals Pair with developers and engineers as needed to encourage best practices so that value is added as quickly as possible on new initiatives Establish a security first mindset in partnership with the IT Security team Resolve bottle necks in the service impacting user experiences Develop foundational code patterns to enable team delivery Identify and develop with team opportunities to lower the lead time to value Define and implement observability strategies Mentor and coach developers and platform engineers Work with product owners and business analysts to write user stories Designing and developing resilient, scalable solutions that help drive user success Reviewing technical designs and providing recommendations on technical direction to both peers and senior management Develop timelines and evaluate & communicate risks & progress. Be a Seagen culture ambassador by establishing positive and productive working relationships across all levels and teams by embodying the Seagen values: Passion for helping patients Integrity Scientific excellence Diversity, teamwork, and mutual respect Innovation Great work environment Qualifications 7+ years’ experience in software or platform engineering, including experience managing production systems 2+ years of experience as a project lead or management experience leading the delivery of highly scalable technology solutions Experience architecting, designing, analyzing, running, and maturing large-scale distributed systems Experience working in a DevOps organization Demonstrated experience delivering with a security first mindset Expertise in a programming language such as Python or Java Demonstrated success working on software engineering problems that span multiple products Understanding of the complete software development lifecycle from requirements to production operations Experience with Machine Learning is preferred Be highly motivated and demonstrate willingness to learn and to grow within the role Demonstrated ability to deliver through other software or platform engineers Evidence of a strong sense of ownership and product understanding Experience working across multiple cross functional engineering teams globally Experience being creative and having initiative to improve product quality coverage and effectiveness Experience communicating with technical and non-technical stakeholders across all levels of the organization jobTitle: Senior Manager Quality Control Microbiology - Launch Pad
jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. By working together with a shared dedication and diverse perspectives, we are able to reach our full potential and make a real difference in the world. Summary Seagen’s new cGMP manufacturing facility “project Launch Pad” is being built in Everett, Washington, just North of Seattle. Launch Pad will be a greenfield build encompassing end-to-end manufacturing capabilities for biologics and antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs). The Sr. Manager of QC Microbiology oversees microbiological sampling, testing, laboratory controls, and related quality systems. This position leads a team of Scientist and Associate level staff in a high-throughput laboratory supporting raw material, in-process, drug substance and drug product release testing, environmental monitoring, and GMP facility and utility qualification. This position also provides technical expertise on the site’s microbial control strategy, aseptic technique, gowning qualification, and related functions. The Launch Pad QC Microbiology laboratory will support drug substance and sterile drug product manufacturing for both clinical and commercial products and will work closely with other Seagen sites to ensure the safety and compliance of our products and manufacturing operations. This position reports to the Director of Quality Control – Launch Pad. Principal Responsibilities Manage the day-to-day operations of a high throughput laboratory performing bioburden, endotoxin, sterility, viable and non-viable particulates, microbial identification, and other microbiological techniques Support the commissioning and qualification of large-scale biologic drug substance and drug product manufacturing operations, including GMP utilities (WFI, compressed gasses, clean steam), ISO classified spaces, aseptic and sterile manufacturing, and cleaning verification / validation studies Train and support Manufacturing staff on aseptic technique, gowning, personnel monitoring, and related functions Recruit, hire, train, and mentor outstanding QC laboratory staff Author, review, and approve procedures, risk assessments, protocols, reports, and other deliverables supporting GMP operations Ensure completion of change controls, investigations, and CAPA within agreed upon timelines Act as SME on investigations and changes related to microbial control of the facility, utilities, processes, and personnel Manage on-call and shift-based teams as necessary to provide support for operations during evenings and weekends Establish and maintain an environmental monitoring and trending program that provides actionable information to detect risks and keep the facility in a continual state of control Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and technologies that reduce risk, increase GMP compliance, or enable more efficient operations Ensure that the QC Microbiology laboratory maintains compliance with Seagen and health authority requirements and aligns practices and technologies with other Seagen operations Qualifications 12+ years relevant GMP/QC experience Bachelor's or Master’s degree in microbiology, biology, or a related discipline 5+ years of experience supervising / managing direct reports. Experience managing indirect reports preferred Extensive knowledge of compendial and regulatory requirements for microbiology laboratories and aseptic operations Experience managing shift-based staff in a laboratory that requires rapid turnaround testing and seamless handoff between shifts Technical expertise in microbiology QC for product, including bioburden, endotoxin, sterility testing, media qualification, disinfectant effectiveness studies, and cleaning validation Experience purchasing, commissioning and qualifying QC microbiology equipment such as plate readers, incubators, particle counters, and laminar flow hoods Demonstrated ability to work productively with Manufacturing, QA, Engineering, and other stakeholders to develop robust workflows, troubleshoot microbial control issues, and support investigations and change controls Experience using common laboratory software such as LIMS, ELN, or MODA Experience supporting internal and health authority audits and inspections As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. The Sr. Product Manager, Digital Marketing is responsible for partnering with the brand and media teams to develop a recommended strategy, create digital programs, and create integrated digital experiences for patients and consumers to support the achievement of brand goals. Primary accountabilities include managing and evolving the digital ecosystem for TIVDAK, the definition of channel strategy and tactics, and effectively applying a current, in-depth understanding of how patients and consumers are engaging with digital and social media content. This position will report to the Associate Director of Promotion for TIVDAK and work closely with leadership in Sales, Global Market Insights, Customer Innovation, as well as well as Corporate Communications, Advocacy, and other relevant cross-functional partners. Responsibilities Lead development of the digital channel strategy for TIVDAK including the business plan, communication tactics, production, and implementation plans. Ensure key consumer insights, data, and understanding are represented and leveraged throughout the brand planning process Manage execution of marketing strategies for the digital channel including all related initiatives and tactics; ensure delivery of a positive, compliant patient and consumer experience, and meet annual business plan goals Effectively participate in PARC (Medical/Legal/Regulatory Review); accountable for ensuring all digital deliverables are reviewed and approved per established processes Build and maintain productive agency relationships and effectively manage integration among agency partners Own the media plan, inclusive of budget and performance. Drive awareness of media performance and key insights across the functional leadership team, adjusting investment as needed Proactively monitor emerging digital and social trends; anticipate and resolve challenges that will arise as technologies and platforms change Collaborate with the Global Market Insights team to identify key insights for the brand and channel, maintain a current understanding of patient and consumer data, and identify opportunities to improve relevant marketing efforts Collaborate with the Customer Innovation Group to refine use of digital platforms and resolve challenges that will arise as technologies and platforms change Effectively manage digital and social media marketing budgets; advocate as necessary with the brand team to secure funding for key initiatives, make sound recommendations to the team on budget trade-off decisions and risk management Develop and actively monitor measures to assess the performance of digital and social media marketing efforts; jobTitle: Senior Research Associate, Small Molecule Analytical Development
jobDescription: Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. Summary The core responsibility of this job is the design and optimization analytical tests to support development of novel small molecule active pharmaceutical ingredients and drug-linkers. The ideal candidate will possess knowledge of modern chromatographic and spectrometric techniques with demonstrated application of these skills in supporting small molecule analytical development. Work is typically project based and highly collaborative. Principal Responsibilities Perform analytical test development in support of process development of small molecule pharmaceuticals and intermediates Develop reaction process monitoring analytics through chromatographic or other techniques. Work collaboratively with process development to ensure test methods generate suitable data Execute impurity and unknown identification workflows using spectroscopic instrumentation (e.g., MS, FTIR) Qualify test methods against ICH guidelines. Prepare technical transfer documents and development reports. Assist in troubleshooting analytical methods with third party contract manufacturers Be an active member and team player in the Chemical Process and Analytical Development (CPAD) group Qualifications 2-4 years professional experience in Chemistry, Biochemistry, or related field Hands on familiarity in common analytical separation techniques (HPLC, GC) used to measure purity and potency of organic compounds Hands-on familiarity in techniques used for the characterization of the identity and physical properties of organic compounds (e.g., MS, FTIR, UV) Familiar with modern drug development concepts (e.g., DoE, QbD) Excellent time management and attention to detail Excellent written and oral communication skills Education Master’s degree or Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, or related field As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, relocation assistance and much more. Summary Seagen is seeking a highly collaborative Scientist to lead research activities supporting new oncology drugs during pre-clinical development and early-stage clinical testing. We are seeking an individual who can leverage their passion for patients to work on cross-functional project teams and bring biologic therapeutics into the clinic. In addition to scientific excellence, this position requires excellent collaboration, effective written and oral communication, innovation, and strategic thinking. Candidates should possess a strong molecular/cell biology, immunology, or bioengineering background with excellent interpersonal skills, clear communication, and accountability. Principal Responsibilities Design and implement comprehensive experimental plans to inform project decision-making and regulatory filings. Communicate plans and results effectively to project teams and leadership Identify, design, and execute critical experiments to drive projects through IND and early clinical trials Identify, design, and execute critical experiments to explore new/expanded clinical opportunities Develop and implement research plans to expand our understanding of therapeutic mechanisms of action and predictors of drug sensitivity and resistance Collaborate with clinical and translational sciences to help guide the clinical development strategy for novel therapeutics. Serve as a single point of contact for cross-functional/interdepartmental research activities Key contributor to regulatory documents and peer-reviewed publications Ensure experiments are appropriately documented and summarized May provide research support/oversight for external collaborations and represent Research on advisory boards Represent Research and present work at scientific conferences Serve as a mentor for junior scientists Required Qualifications Ph.D. degree in Biology, Biochemistry, Bioengineering, Immunology, or another related field plus 2-4 years of experience Candidates with a BS or MS degree and extensive drug development experience in a biotech industry setting will also be considered Strong background in experimental cancer biology, biochemical, cell/molecular, and/or immunological techniques (e.g. flow cytometry, Elisa, western blot, cell line engineering, immunofluorescence, etc.) Preferred Qualifications Experience with a variety of cell culture models (3D, co-culture, etc.) and cell-based assays Experience with murine cancer models (xenograft, PDX, and/or syngeneic). Proven proficiency in the design of in vivo experiments as well as sample assessment using a variety of laboratory techniques Ability to work both in a team-based environment and independently with outstanding problem-solving, organizational, and interpersonal skills Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively to a wide range of audiences Knowledge and expertise in oncology drug development, therapeutic antibodies, and/or ADCs As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Scientist/Engineer is part of a team of highly skilled Scientists and Engineers responsible for technical and scientific support to manufacturing of all Seagen products, whether manufactured internally or at contract manufacturing organizations (CMO’s). The Incumbent is an expert on biologics Drug Product manufacturing, collaborates with peers from Development functions to ensure a high degree of manufacturability of the processes being developed and will contribute to or lead technology transfers to or between contract manufacturers. The MSAT Prin. Scientist/Engineer will support process validation and GMP manufacturing incl. shop-floor presence and trouble-shooting activities at CMO’s, working closely with QA and QC. The incumbent provides technical and scientific leadership as subject matter expert (SME) relating to manufacturing processes, change control, scale-down/up studies, technology implementation projects and process optimization. Principal Responsibilities Supporting manufacturing activities for clinical and commercial manufacturing of biologics Drug Product (liquid and lyophilized) at Seagen internal manufacturing sites and CMO’s Providing technical and scientific leadership as subject matter expert (SME) relating to technology transfers, manufacturing processes, complex deviations, technical troubleshooting, CAPA design and implementation, process monitoring, change control and process optimization Act as Technical Lead for transfer of processes into manufacturing facilities Support the DP throughout the 3 phases of Validation (Process Design, Process Qualification and Continuous Process Verification) Partnering with other functions to apply e.g. modeling tools ensuring that scale-down/up and characterization of manufacturing processes is robust and scientifically sound leading to a predictable and highly consistent performance and a well characterized process Providing guidance for root cause investigations of process related deviations in a timely, comprehensive and conclusive manner. Leads the data analysis of process data statistics, identifies process deviations, assesses product impact, prepares technical reports and proposes process solutions and improvements Acting as shop-floor support (person-in-plant) during tech transfer, validation studies and commercial manufacturing Develop, optimize and review Master Batch Records and Batch Records during development, clinical supply and transfer to commercial supply. Providing guidance for comprehensive facility fit assessments and gap analysis for the relevant part of the GMP manufacturing Working cross-functionally supporting Development and Manufacturing as well as CMO’s in order to prepare User Requirement Specifications (URS) of novel process technologies and facility expansions/modifications to maintain state-of-the-art production meeting business needs Interfacing with Development and manufacturing sites for know-how transfers and process data analysis & mapping in order to anticipate potential risks and opportunities for improvements supporting next generation manufacturing processes. Identifies and initiates process and procedural changes to improve process performance, robustness, productivity, safety, efficiency and compliance Qualifications Strong scientific and technical experience within relevant development and/or manufacturing technologies and unit operations relating to biologics fill/finish and lyophilization. Preferably experience with equipment utilized in commercial cGMP manufacturing facilities Good knowledge of structured methodologies for process design, scale-up/down models, process control strategies, process validation and continuous process verification The ability to work effectively in small matrix teams in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and a high level of urgency. Highly motivated with the ability to work independently as well as on cross-functional and cross-site teams Experience working with Contract Manufacturing Organizations is desirable, but not mandatory Able to effectively establish and maintain productive relationships with senior technical staff within and outside of Seagen The candidate must demonstrate high levels of integrity. Key competencies are management of complexity, driving for results, problem-solving and collaborating cross-functionally Strong communication skills and computer literacy are essential Fluency in spoken and written English is mandatory Experience with innovation and operational excellence is desirable A good understanding of statistical analysis and continuous process verification is desirable Education Bachelor’s degree in biotechnology, chemical engineering, or another relevant life-science discipline with a minimum of 12 years of industrial experience in the relevant process technologies, technology transfers, validation, GMP manufacturing and/or process optimization. Alternatively a Masters’ degree with a minimum of 10 years experience or a PhD degree with minimum 8 years of industrial experience As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Summary The Senior Scientist, Process Chemistry is responsible for developing novel chemical processes for small molecule APIs and ADC drug-linkers for each development stage, from pre-clinical to commercial manufacturing. They will work on chemical development problems of diverse scope to identify innovative and practical processes. They identify and champion new ideas and technologies that enhance business processes within small molecule development. They develop an external presence as a technical leader in the field by authoring journal articles, presenting posters at leading external scientific meetings, or as an invited speaker. Responsibilities Demonstrate exemplary scientific leadership through the evaluation and design of synthetic routes to complex molecules which would serve as the foundation of efficient processes for the preparation of multi-gram to kilogram scales of small molecule APIs and ADC drug-linkers Apply the latest technologies in both organic and analytical chemistry to develop and interrogate chemical processes while capturing critical data for the determination of reaction parameters that contribute to process performance and scale up Use established principles of chemical process development to design efficient processes with facile unit operations Leverage literature, ICH/Regulatory guidance, and practical experience to perform their work and influence CMC strategies Recommend and implement new technology that advances knowledge and productivity within department Author and review technical reports, manufacturing documents, regulatory submissions and publications Present at department, project team, and sr. management meetings. May present externally at scientific conferences Serve as a technical advisor to senior management on risks to project. Create a long-term vision of the skillsets needed for the group and build the group towards that vision (either recruit or train). Motivate and support the career development and technical growth of direct reports Qualifications Possess a high level of expertise in organic chemistry, reaction mechanisms, and knowledge of current advances in the field Proven track record in developing synthetic routes and optimizing chemical processes for complex target molecules Experienced in resolving cross-functional CMC issues in small molecule development Excellent oral and written communication skills, ability to lead cross-functional development teams, and capability to provide strategic contributions Principal scientist level requires broad subject matter expertise in multiple technical areas of formulation or DP process development, working knowledge of both. Extensive experience required in supporting regulatory submissions and a thorough understanding of ICH and Regulatory Guidance Education Degree in Organic Chemistry/Pharmaceutical Chemistry M.S. with 8+ years or Ph.D. with 4+ years of industrial experience As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. By working together with a shared dedication and diverse perspectives, we are able to reach our full potential and make a real difference in the world. Seagen is a fast-growing company and has an abundance of opportunities available for you to grow your career. Put your passion to work at Seagen and join us! Summary The Sr. Validation Engineer is part of a team of highly skilled Scientists and Engineers responsible for technical and scientific support to the manufacture of all Seagen products, whether manufactured internally or at contract manufacturing organizations (CMO’s). The incumbent will be part of a validation team which is responsible for the end-to-end validation processes. Specifically, this role has responsibility for developing and delivering GMP utilities, equipment, and process validation programs to ensure compliance with applicable cGMPs and global health authority regulations. The Sr. Validation Engineer partners with Manufacturing, Quality, Regulatory and IT to develop validation plans and ensure their execution and lifecycle management. The holder of this position is likely to be a subject matter expert in one or more aspects of validation. Principal Responsibilities Develop and share validation expertise and scientific understanding of key Pharmaceutical Operations. Is a subject matter expert in validation approaches (e.g., Facility, Utility, Equipment, Process & Computer System validation, risk-based approaches etc.) and apply this understanding to ensure Product Supply manufacturing operations are maintained in a constant state of compliance Develops, executes, and documents validation programs for facilities/utilities and equipment (both internally and for externally manufactured products) Support products throughout the 3 phases of Validation (Process Design, Process Qualification and Continuous Process Verification) Develops and leads Validation Master plans, in collaboration with manufacturing sites (both Internal and External) and Quality and Regulatory functions Develop project plans for validation activities and ensure plans are delivered Executes and provides guidance and oversight and for site validation of facilities/utilities, equipment and technologies and modifications of existing systems Develops risk-based approaches to revalidation of products, processes, and systems Leads the validation activities as part of the new facility/process design, build and qualification Shares best practice in utility/equipment/process/computer system validation and associated disciplines Interfaces with multiple sites and departments (i.e., Internal, and external (CMO’s) Manufacturing, Quality & Regulatory) to deliver best practice validation packages Proactively engages with Manufacturing sites/Development and QA and advocates the use of QbD principles for facilities, utilities, and equipment Responsible for expanding and continuously updating a validation and regulatory knowledge base. Advises on validation and risk-based approaches Develops Standards, Guidelines and SOPs to enhance the quality and robustness of our manufacturing operations, knowledge transfer and technical support processes Works cross-functionally supporting Development and Manufacturing as well as CMO’s to develop validation plans and approaches, including novel process technologies and facility expansions/modifications to maintain state-of-the-art production capability Qualifications Extensive technical knowledge of validation and current validation approaches and practice Excellent knowledge of pharmaceutical standards, regulations, current industry practices, and experience with interpretation and application of guidelines, regulations, and standards Experience in managing validation programs in support of GxP Operations (Facility/utilities and Equipment) Experience of fronting regulatory inspections on validation Experience with validation of biologics and sterile facilities Experience of facility, equipment, cleaning, computer systems validation and continuous process verification Experience working with Contract Manufacturing Organizations The ability to work effectively in small matrix teams in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and a high level of urgency. Highly motivated with the ability to work independently as well as on cross-functional and cross-site teams The ability to influence and work across organizational boundaries Strong communication skills and computer literacy are essential Fluency in spoken and written English is mandatory A good understanding of statistical analysis and continuous process verification is desirable Education Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Pharmacy, Pharmaceutical Sciences, Mechanical/Civil/Chemical engineering, or another relevant life-science discipline with a minimum of 10 years of industrial experience in validation practices and approaches. Alternatively, a Masters’ degree with a minimum of 8 years experience or a PhD degree with minimum 6 years of industrial experience. As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, relocation assistance and much more. Summary Seagen is seeking a Software Asset Analyst to join the Workplace Computing team, serving as the operational lead for our software asset management system within our ServiceNow toolkit. This role will operate as the SME responsible for the functionality, performance, and daily operation of our SAM tools and workflow. The SAM program plays a critical role in software compliance assurance, software consolidation, cost management, and SW availability. As such, this role is at the nexus for pulling together software usage and inventory data, contract entitlements and financial spend. This role will work across multiple teams – including technology vendor management, purchasing, security, legal and other IT business groups – to provide relevant data that saves cost, reduces risk, and improves our internal staff experience. The Software Asset Analyst will oversee operations to build, manage, and improve the SAM program, including lifecycle, inventory and license management, policy and process management, forecasting, procurement, renewal calendaring, and disposition. The candidate should possess strong technical and analytical skills, the ability to work independently in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment, a work ethic based on a desire to exceed expectations, and excellent interpersonal skills including written and oral communication. Roles & Responsibilities Manage lifecycle of software titles in ServiceNow, utilizing publisher packs and the Software Asset Management Professional module (SamPro) Maintain software entitlement procurement and cost data for acquisition and retirement tracking Create and maintain data: software models, custom part numbers, manufacturers, vendors, and custom discovery maps Assist in the development of improvements and enhancements to the Software Asset Management toolkit Monitor software entitlements to ensure compliance with license agreements Work with technology vendor management, legal, and the application portfolio committee to review software agreements, provide accurate licensing data, and review and support new and existing applications Build and maintain SW catalog items and corresponding workflows to facilitate automation within the self-service portal Maintain relevant software configuration items within a CMDB Provide analysis of software data that can be used to drive key business decisions Manage license true-up, co-terms & reconciliation Provide support during software publisher audits Identify savings opportunities through software re-harvesting and license optimization Respond to requests from Software Owners, end users, managers, developers, and team members for specific IT Software Asset Management information. Collaborate with management to define cost savings, software compliances and service improvement opportunities Qualifications 5yrs of work experience directly related to software license management 3yrs experience with ServiceNow's Software Asset Management Modules including Sam Pro 10yrs experience in IT Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, including the ability to accumulate, organize, and assimilate large amounts of data Experience implementing at least two different Software Asset Management systems Understanding of software Asset Management tools and practices Knowledge of product use rights for publishers such as Microsoft, Adobe, etc. Ability to deal tactfully with vendors, suppliers, and contractors who provide a broad spectrum of products and services Strong experience interpreting licensing terms and conditions Demonstrated competency of IT contract administration, purchasing, and procurement General knowledge of accounting, financial and logistics processes as they relate to IT Asset Management Strong written, verbal communication and cross-functional team skills Experience presenting to senior management executive level audiences Working knowledge of and experience maintaining data within a CMDB, ITAM or CSAM certification preferred As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. The Supervisor reports to the Downstream Manufacturing Manager and works collectively with other Supervisors, Specialists, and senior associates to lead production activities and projects related to Downstream operations. Principal Responsibilities Performs oversight of downstream operations ensuring they are executed safely and compliantly in accordance with OSHA and cGMP guidelines. Summary The MSAT Technical Product Steward is part of a team of highly skilled Scientists and Engineers responsible for technical and scientific support for manufacturing Seagen products manufactured internally or at contract manufacturing organizations (CMO’s). This position has responsibility for the technical oversight of Seagen’s global supply network and consequently requires remote leadership and work across different time zones. The incumbent is an expert and has extensive knowledge of Small Molecule API and Drug Linker manufacturing processes and plays a technical leadership and coordinating role for the DL/SM API manufacturing process working in close collaboration with MSAT experts. This role partners with the Strategic Product Supply Leader, Internal/External Manufacturing Manager, and the Product Quality Leader ensuring the robustness of the manufacturing process, product quality and continuity of supply. The incumbent leverages knowledge across the organization and collaborates with peers from Development functions to ensure the robustness of new manufacturing processes. The Technical Product Steward will be accountable for technology transfers to or between contract manufacturers. The Technical Product Steward will support process validation, GMP manufacturing and trouble-shooting activities at CMO’s, working closely with QA and QC. The incumbent provides technical and scientific leadership as subject matter expert (SME) relating to manufacturing processes, change control, scale-down/up studies, technology implementation projects and process optimization. The incumbent coaches and shares expertise and knowledge across Technical Operations. Principal Responsibilities Work in collaboration with the Strategic Product Supply Lead (SPSL) to develop and execute Product Supply manufacturing strategies Be accountable for the provision of technical oversight for manufacturing activities for clinical and commercial manufacturing of Drug Linkers/SM API’s at CMO’s. Ensuring that manufacturing process are and remain aligned across manufacturing sites/CMOs Partner with the Internal/External Manufacturing Manager and the Quality Steward to ensure the robustness of the manufacturing process, product quality and continuity of supply Provide overall technical leadership for the Drug Linker manufacturing process working in close collaboration with MSAT SMEs Provide technical and scientific leadership as subject matter expert (SME) relating to technology transfers, manufacturing processes, complex deviations, technical troubleshooting, CAPA design and implementation, process monitoring, change control and process optimization Be accountable for the Technology Transfers into manufacturing facilities (internal or external). Identify and initiate process and procedural changes to improve process performance, robustness, productivity, safety, efficiency, and compliance Advise on Scientific and Business developments (including Technologies, Processes, Products, Input Materials, Regulations etc.). Support Due Diligence activities, CMO selections etc. Coach and share knowledge across Technical Operations Qualifications Extensive scientific and technical experience within relevant development and/or manufacturing technologies and unit operations relating to SM API/Drug Linker manufacturing. Experience with small and commercial scale equipment utilized in cGMP manufacturing facilities (including clinical manufacturing) Experience of senior technical leadership Good knowledge of structured methodologies for process design, scale-up/down models, process control strategies, process validation and continuous process verification The ability to work effectively in small matrix teams in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities and a high level of urgency. Description Position at Seagen Seagen is a global, multi-product biotechnology company dedicated to developing and commercializing transformative cancer medicines. As the industry leader in antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) technology, we pioneered a new generation in the science of harnessing antibodies to deliver cell-killing agents directly to cancer cells. Seagen’s dedication to improving the lives of cancer patients goes beyond science, and we believe that every employee has a role in contributing to this mission. By working together with a shared dedication and diverse perspectives, we are able to reach our full potential and make a real difference in the world. Seagen is a fast-growing company and has an abundance of opportunities available for you to grow your career. Put your passion to work at Seagen and join us! Summary As Seagen continues to grow, The Vice President, Corporate Development is key in setting the long-term strategic plan for the company. This position provides strategic and tactical leadership, counsel and direction to support key business objectives. They will be responsible for securing and maintaining partnerships with other biotech and/or pharmaceutical companies. Additionally, they be key in identifying, negotiating, structuring, and executing strategic acquisitions/investments and partnerships. Principal Responsibilities Serve on the Leadership Team for the Executive Vice President of Corp Dev and Alliance Management Lead the clinical stage prospecting effort to find clinical stage assets to supplement and complement Seagen’s pipeline Negotiate clinical stage in-licensing deals and collaborations Evaluate M&A targets and oversee financial assessment (combined LRP/pro-forma, impact to financial statements) and make deal pitches to executive management and the board Work closely with Global Product Teams to evaluate and coordinate clinical combination strategies with external CTCSA (clinical trial and supply agreements) or strategic partnerships Lead corporate strategy projects as needed at the direction of the Executive Committee and CEO Provide support and take on some transaction work for and with the VP of External Innovation to help with Research stage deal making Lead initial integration of deals after signing before fully adopted by JXCs, PM and AM Lead M&A integration in collaboration with Alliance Management Provide guidance to the development of analytical models and work with finance to perform financial analyses to comprehensively value opportunities Provide clear explanations and make well-founded recommendations to senior management Establish collaborative, effective, and trusting relationships with key internal functions and leadership including commercial, R&D, legal, and finance to ensure the free flow of information and ideas Manage complex contract negotiations and work closely with legal counsel to expeditiously negotiate and sign agreements Maintain a strong network of industry contacts and continually seek competitive intelligence; and Actively participate in relevant external meetings and conferences Outlicense/partner clinical stage assets on an as-needed basis at the direction of the EC and Board Required Qualifications A bachelor’s degree is required At least 10 years of business/corporate development experience with an emphasis on the biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry A solid understanding of oncology products, players and technologies, and a rolodex of industry contacts Strong leadership and communication skills, problem-solving ability and creativity Ability to effectively interface with the commercial organization, R&D, finance, legal, and executive management A leadership role and demonstrated success in initiating, closing and managing significant business/corporate development transactions, including product and technology partnerships and company acquisitions A scientific background/literacy with strong analytical capabilities Preferred Qualifications MBA or JD preferred As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families.
